Reviews.Title: “Nice place in great location”
Reviews.Author: acia83
Reviews.Content: I was in Montreal 2 days and I stayed in Hotel du Manoir St Denis. The location is excellent, just in the middle of the Quartier Latin, a vibrant area full of cafÃ©s and restaurants. The public transports are very easy to reach, the subway is at 3mins walking. The room is very nice, all in wood with fridge and TV inside, the bathroom is small but good as well. The breakfast was quite limited (a sweet snack and a drink) but good. Overall the relation quality-price is fine, since the service is good and the cost not too high for the city. The staff was very kind and friendly, it was a pleasure to talk to them and ask for some advices. Definitely a place to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Clean, Comfortable, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: ReluctantNomad
Reviews.Content: This is probably the best value you can get. The rooms are clean, cozy and quiet. There's free WiFi and the hotel is perfectly located, close to everything, including the bus terminal and the Metro (subway). I've been to this hotel 3 times and enjoyed it every time.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: nikhilmh
Reviews.Content: I had a 3 - night stay at Du Manoir. The hotel has a great location, lots of restaurants and bars around and the subway station is close too. The price is is low, the rooms are small and not a sound proof at all. If you are a traveler on a budget then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Pro: Location, Con: Location”
Reviews.Author: Tiggero5501
Reviews.Content: Hotel St-Denis is in a great location, in the heart of the Latin Quarter and close to the subway; many restaurants, bars, and shopping; and a short walk to Old Montreal. With that said, the busy area is not conducive to a peaceful night's sleep. My room faced Rue St Denis, and on a Saturday night, after all the bars and clubs close, there was an overflow of loud, drunk people who spilled into the street and caused a ruckus until about 4am. Maybe it would be quieter on a weeknight, but can't say for sure since I only stayed the weekend. The room itself was fine--basic but clean, and the hotel staff was very nice. And if you have a car, the hotel also has a paid parking garage good for 24 hours. If you can get a room that doesn't face the main street, I imagine your stay would be a bit quieter...otherwise, I'd recommend going somewhere else for a more peaceful overnight stay.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: rubyinthedust
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for value and close to the nightlife, here it is. But if you want to sleep sound or open the window at night, or perhaps have a car, you might want to think again about this hotel. The reception was very polite, internet worked fine and the coffee wasn't even bad, but you have to carry your mufffin and coffee back up to the room. The walls are old and thin and the doorknob just spun around.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: OttawaLily
Reviews.Content: It is gross!! It was a very dirty room. Sanitation questionable. Pest issues likely. Did not eat breakfast but it did not look great. Near adult entertainment. Worst hotel I have stayed in. In need of major renos. Did not feel very secure. Highly recommend staying somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be back”
Reviews.Author: beckitybeck
Reviews.Content: Seemed too good to be true and it was. Location is great, but there are also many other hotels on the same block with similar prices and much better value - we were so happy we moved to Hotel Montreal Espace Confort just a few doors down. At Hotel du Manior St Denis, we just had an overall feeling of yuckiness and uncleanliness. Walls are paper thin, good luck if you're next to a room with kids or drunks. Rooms are not thoroughly cleaned between guests - there was trash left on the table from previous person. Calls were supposed to be free, but were not. There was no bathmat. Strange things that just make you wish you'd gone somewhere else. Staff helpfulness varied widely - some lied to your face and ignored you and some were more sincere. Don't bother with breakfast - microwaved croissants are not worth it, go to Tim Hortons or Starbucks down the street.

Reviews.Title: “This is not my first time staying here and it won't be my last!!”
Reviews.Author: ro0
Reviews.Content: We come yearly to Montreal for our anniversary and this is the nicest place to stay in. Great friendly staff, the location can not be beaten, great value for your money, very safe and secure. I only wish the room showers were a bit bigger and an elevator to the third floor (and i am just being picky).

Reviews.Title: “Cheap room, central location, but no peace of mind!”
Reviews.Author: ACuming
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed in was clean.. ish. The rooms were definitely smoked in because there was a lingering odour, but that may have been coming from the underwear that was left on the towel rack in the bathroom. So they clearly don't clean the rooms all too thoroughly. The area is good if you want to be close to shopping, bars and restaurants, however, there were squeegee kids across the street, and no parking. A colourful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Rude and run down”
Reviews.Author: Zazix
Reviews.Content: Its an old gloomy smelly property you do not feel like entering. I booked it a cheap price of 49 dollars but the hotel required a prepayment which I had to make before even seing the room. I understand why: once I saw the room I felt like leaving. The hotel was old and gloomy. Rooms smell mould. To disguise it the hotel turned on a very strong ventilation (which could not be controlled from inside the room). It did not help the mould smell but the room freezing. I tried to sleep at night but could not due to continuous noise coming from the street. Finally after 2 days I moved to another hotel which was clean and comfortable for the same price. My prepayment has never been reimbursed.

Reviews.Title: “what are you looking for?”
Reviews.Author: campeale
Reviews.Content: i've been there for 4 nights. PRO: for sure the POSITION: just at the end of the street you have the undergound BERRI-UQAM, simply the most important of montreal with lines to go everywhere. Again, you have lots of cool restaurants, pubs, coffee opened 24H. The PRICE is good.. low price.. low quality of everything in the hotel. CONS: STAFF is rude and unprofessional. ROOMS are very small. CLENING ROOM made in late afternoon adn only 2 days in 4 i stayed. In other words in you are in a 15 days trip tour throgh CANADA and USA and want just a cheap place where to sleep, located in the right position to visit the city.. OK.. book here!! If you want a great hotel where to stay confortable and relaxing.. NEEEEEXT...!!! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Du Manoir may just become my regular spot”
Reviews.Author: ibesmo
Reviews.Content: I had to travel from New York to Montreal for a week. Wanting to find accommodations that would not break the bank, I came across du Manoir. The rates advertised were cheap with a two-and-a-half start rating. Location was key for me and this hotel is near any and everything Montreal has to offer, be it metro stations, rue St Catherine or rue St Laurent and everything in between. This is a no-frills place but they keep extra clean. Neighborhood and hotel are both safe and never had any issues leaving my phone or my laptop in the room while I went out to party. The staff behind the front desk were very helpful as I kept asking them to change things with my reservation around (which they did immediately). There are other more expensive options in Montreal for sure, but this is the best value for money i have ever come across. I visit montreal often, and this may just become my regular spot

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!!! Verschrikkelijk!!! Never again.....nooit meer!”
Reviews.Author: NeverStManoir
Reviews.Content: I arrived after a long trip from the Netherlands to Montreal. I booked a camper but it was necessary to stay in a hotel for one night! I was stupid and choose for this hotel! The guy at the reception was a little bit....not so very clever! I payed with my credit card and go for a sleep. In de middle of the night a lot of dronknoise came from the terasse at the front site of the hotel (I slept at the back site) The next morning breakfast was not ready (international breakfast from 6 til 9) while de boy slept in his chair. I checked out while I payed the day of arrival. Never, never, never again this hotel. It was creepy, terrible! Two weeks later I(back in the Netherlands) i recieved a mail from the booking operator. I didn't arrive at the Manoir hotel so they want to have taken the 57,24 CAD (49 CAD for the room + the tax) from my credit card!!! Ohhh my god. It wasn't worth the first CAD 57,24!!! And now.....they taken away another time CAD 57,24! Thank god I did have the little ticket of my paying!! My booking operater is traying to make it ondone i'll hope thay can fixed it! It isn't worth one rate but i'm afraid there's no possibility to choose for zero rate!

Reviews.Title: “Horrific Experience”
Reviews.Author: denisa30
Reviews.Content: Please don't waste your time! This hotel is grimy, outdated and I have never witnessed worse customer service anywhere else! When my friends and I arrived at the hotel, we were "greeted" by an irritated old man behind the desk who, after giving us a round of dirty looks, refused to honor our reservation because the price we booked on Booking.com was "too low". He told us we had to pay a higher price or get out. Obviously we chose to go somewhere else rather than we treated with such blatant contempt. We ended up down the street at Auberge Montreal which was much cleaner and the customer service was great. Even though we ended up at a much better hotel, the experience left my friends and I with a really bad impression so try and avoid this place at all cost! Not only was the customer service horrific, but it is illegal for hotels to try and raise the price that was already booked online.

Reviews.Title: “Would love to throw eggs at this place!”
Reviews.Author: MissFavela
Reviews.Content: The worst customer service I've ever encountered!!! Man at check-in refused to honor our reservation at the price we booked online. Insisted we pay more or go to another hotel. When we told him we would only pay what we booked online, he proceeded to call the online booking company to yell and complain. All the while, he lost several customers who arrived and quickly left after overhearing and witnessing this disgruntled man yelling over the phone! I've never felt so unwelcome in my life. So, basically, we were kicked out and had to look for another hotel. We ended up staying at Auberge Montreal Espace Confort just up the street. Very cute and friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: boogalieboo
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I chose to stay here for our last night in Montreal because the first place we stayed in was just awful! The location is ideal for young adults who want to be close to the nightlife. We asked to see the room first before booking it to make sure it was better than where we were staying. The room is very basic. It has a comfortable double bed, shower (no tub), 20 inch TV with basic cable, and a small fridge for bottled water etc. The room was clean. A small breakfast was also included (one orange juice or coffee with one croissant). Most of all, the price was only $56 a night taxes included! The downside was that it was a long and steep walk up 3 flights of stairs to get to our room and we had to carry our luggage ourselves. The room looks outdated and you can't control its temperature. The hallways are very narrow. The rooms are not "soundproof." Despite all this, it is worth it! Keep in mind, you're only spending about $56 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to party for the weekend”
Reviews.Author: roczberry
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on Booking.com and it was perfect for what I was looking for. I stayed there one night, went to the clubs, the casino. It was right next to the club area and the drive to the casino was quick and easy.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place”
Reviews.Author: ChocolateFiend_of_VT
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Hotel du Manoir about half a dozen times over the past eight years, and I think it offers a superb value for the price. It is not a five-star hotel, but the rooms are clean and comfy, with high ceilings and spotless bathrooms. There are many conveniences that are great if you're on a budget: A little fridge in each room, telephone with free local calls, free Internet access in the lobby, and a free continental breakfast (er, which I've never woken up early enough to try). The location is fabulous, right in the lively Latin Quarter, with wonderful little import shops and tons of coffee shops and restaurants. (And let me add that it's a perfect location for vegetarians, with two amazing vegetarian restaurants nearby -- Le Commensal practically next door and Yuan about a block away.) From the Latin Quarter you can easily walk to various other parts of Montreal, such as downtown, Old Montreal, Chinatown, etc. Although the neighborhood is lively, I've never had a problem with noise at night. The rooms seem pretty sound-proof. And last but not least, the manager at the front desk is exceptionally kind and helpful, with a wonderful sense of humor!

Reviews.Title: “honest review”
Reviews.Author: goTOeat
Reviews.Content: I took a chance with this hotel because half of the reviews on this site were positive and half were negative. I'm here to set the record straight. This is not a one star hotel, it is a zero star hotel. The location is on the busy St. Denis which would be fine if it were not for the local bum population that's parked right outside your front door step. Upon checking in, it was obvious that this hotel was not up to par. The carpeted and cramped stairway featured a large stain near the top where someone had apparently vomitted. The rooms were cramped and haphazardly arranged. At the foot of my bed was our only sink. The toliet and shower were in seperate rooms; the shower boasting a soft floor for which I prayed I wouldn't fall through. The bed linens were not sufficently clean. The air conditioning was ill-suited to handle the cooling of the room. Overall, I would never recommend such a hotel to anyone. This hotel is better suited to be a brothel than a place that accomodates tourists in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Credit Card Scam - Beware”
Reviews.Author: Cowboy_Blue1983
Reviews.Content: When I went to Montreal May 2007 I used my credit card ONLY to book a room at this hotel. A few weeks later I was called by my credit card company informing me that someone, in Montreal, had maxed out my credit card. Since I did not use my credit card anywhere else during my stay at Montreal, I can only suspect that someone working at the Hotel de Manoir St. Denis used my account number. Furthermore, watch what happens to your credit card when you submitted it on arrival. I didn't realize it then but they made a copy of my card. If you are making reservations at this hotel beware of the possible fraud and tampering with your credit card.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs...never again”
Reviews.Author: fabian_32ca
Reviews.Content: As I woke up at 1:00 am in the morning I saw two bedbugs on my pillow...I left the hotel inmediately. I put everything in garbage bags, and then threw everything away: my bag, jeans, socks, underwear, running shoes, and a $275 Ralph Lauren jacket I used as a pillow. Clerk said they 'would close' the room...well, these nasty insects move from room to room. I changed clothes three times before coming home, and I threw away those clothes as well. I sprayed poison on my car, apartment: take my advise: be very very very careful if staying @ this place, or you'll have a surprise when you get home

Reviews.Title: “Great value + location”
Reviews.Author: samjacki
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem of a deal. It's cheap, clean, great location + friendly staff. This was my first visit to Montreal and I didn't know my way around. The hotel is located in the Latin quarter. The neighborhood is a rustic, chic, trendy area. Affordable dining and cool bars. Excellent Thai restaurant and a hookah bar nearby. Our stay was very pleasant and exceeded my expectations. I thought the place would be somewhat rundown considering the low room rates, but it wasnt. It was well maintained and had the feeling of a European hostel. I highly reccomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Du Manoir St. Denis in Montreal for 1 night and felt that it was good value for $63 (including tax). There were 3 of us: 2 guys and 1 girl. Booking 2 rooms at a regular hotel or 1 large room/suite would have been expensive and awkward so staying at Du Manoir was the best solution for us. The guys stayed in a double room with 2 double beds for $75 (including tax) and I had the single room with a double bed. The rooms were basic but clean and they even each had a fridge and TV! What more could you ask for? The concierge was very friendly. It was centrally located too at St. Denis and Ontario, walkable to many restaurants and bars. The only drawback are the thin walls. You can hear your next door neighbour easily. We were there April 10th, so the hotel was not full and all we heard were each other, but during high season I imagine would get noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT go there. Bed bugs!”
Reviews.Author: Shanester
Reviews.Content: We were eaten alive by bed bugs. Bitten all over the body. Appalling. My wife had to return to Sydney. The management denied everything and were rude. The place is disgustingly filthy. Whatever you do - DO NOT GO THERE!!! We have informed the Montreal Health Authority but they diodn't seem to care - never replied.

Reviews.Title: “What a GEM!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Funfolks
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here more than 50 nights over the past few years. The rooms are cabin-nottypine, clean and comfortable. The staff is excellent! Friendly!! and so Accommodating!!! In addition to a great value, their location is ideal. Park your car and DO Montreal by foot. Close to metro, too. We'll be there again in a few weeks and wouldn't think of ever staying anywhere else. It's not the Ritz. We stay at too many four and five star hotels/resorts during any one year, so it's a fefreshing change to stay at such a home-y place when we go to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again...at any price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The only good thing I can say about this hotel is the price (and the fact that it's available even in high seasons). We booked our reservation 2 weeks prior to arriving...but they had no records of it when we got there. Luckily they did have rooms available so we were okay in that respect. Our room was extremely small and not properly ventilated (therefore giving it a mildew oder). There were gums stuck to the ceiling and stains on the carpeted floor. The only good thing I can say about this place is that it was relatively cheap (but not a good value since do you get what you pay for here) and the staff was cordial and polite.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel du Manoir Saint Denis
HotelInfo.Address: 2006 Rue Saint-Denis, Montreal, Quebec H2X 3K7, Canada
